contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Other people|John Williams}} '''John Williams''' (born c.1735, date of death unknown) was a planter and an [[American Revolution]]ary from [[Pitt County, North Carolina]]. He was the son of a Welsh immigrant, and served on the county ''[[Committee of Correspondence]]''. He represented his county in the [[North Carolina]] provisional Assembly of 1777 as well as the state's House of Commons in 1778 and 1779. {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Williams, John | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1735 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Williams, John}} [[Category:Members of the North Carolina House of Representatives]] [[Category:American farmers]] [[Category:1735 births]] [[Category:Year of death missing]] [[Category:American planters]] {{NorthCarolina-politician-stub}}
